stimulusHtml:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The images show the exterior and interior of the Palace of Westminster (Houses of Parliament) in London, England, built 1840â€“1870 C.E. and designed by Charles Barry and Augustus W. N. Pugin.

Describe at least two visual characteristics of the Palace of Westminster (Houses of Parliament).

Using at least two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how the visual characteristics of the Palace of Westminster (Houses of Parliament) reference earlier architectural traditions.

Using specific contextual evidence, explain why the architects chose to include references to earlier architectural traditions in this building.
